stork.ad

Class Ad.Marshaller<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.ad.Ad.Marshaller<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the least specific type this marshaller operates on
    Enclosing class:
    Ad

    public abstract static class Ad.Marshaller<T>
extends Object
    Marshallers handle special cases for converting objects into alternative represtations or unmarshalling ads into new objects. Instantiating a marshaller registers it with the marshalling system. The type handled by the marshaller is determined using reflection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ad.Marshaller(Class<? extends T> clazz)
      Create a new marshaller and register it with the marshalling system.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected stork.ad.Ad.MarshallerDeference defer()
      Subclasses may call this in marshal(...) or unmarshal(...) to defer to the default field marshalling mechanism.
      Object marshal(T t)
      Marshal a T into an Object.
      T unmarshal(Object object)
      Unmarshal an Object into a new instance of T.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ad.Marshaller

        public Ad.Marshaller(Class<? extends T> clazz)
        Create a new marshaller and register it with the marshalling system.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the concrete class this marshaller produces

    • Method Detail

      • unmarshal

        public T unmarshal(Object object)
        Unmarshal an Object into a new instance of T. object will always be a primitive. This method is the last resort if a more specific version of unmarshal(...) is not defined. By default, this defers to a more general handler.
        Parameters:
        object - the AdObject to create a new T from
        Returns:
        An unmarshalled instance of T.

      • marshal

        public Object marshal(T t)
        Marshal a T into an Object. By default, this defers to a more general handler.
        Parameters:
        t - the T to create a new Object from
        Returns:
        An unmarshalled instance of T.

      • defer

        protected final stork.ad.Ad.MarshallerDeference defer()
        Subclasses may call this in marshal(...) or unmarshal(...) to defer to the default field marshalling mechanism. This is done by throwing a special RuntimeException subclass.
        Returns:
        The MarshallerDeference that will be thrown. This will never actually be returned, since calling this method throws the exception, but this can be used to conveniently satisfy Java's safe method exit check by doing throw defer().
        Throws:
        MarshallerDeference - to indicate to the caller that it should defer to another marshalling method
